intro: Sphenogyne peduncularis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil, typical of the sedge family. Sphenogyne peduncularis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
